= Authentication =

Authentication switched to OAuth 2.0, you will *no longer* be able to use Username / Password based Authentication, instead you must authorise against Google's authentication service. 

This allows impersonating domain users if you are logged in as an Administrator.

  * [http://code.google.com/apis/gdata/docs/auth/oauth.html#NoLibrary OAuth in the Google Data Protocol Client Libraries]
  * [http://code.google.com/p/google-api-python-client/wiki/OAuth2 OAuth 2 login on the client side], examples, tips and tricks.

== OAuth 2.0 instructions ==

You will require to register GDataCopier with Google's [https://code.google.com/apis/console/ API Console]. 

  * Head to [https://code.google.com/apis/console/ Google's API Console]
  * Click on API access
  * Create Client ID
  * Choose Installed Application
  * Click create

You will require the

  * Client ID
  * Consumer Secret

Setting these values in GDataCopier

{{{
gdc --register-oauth --client-id=xxx --consumer-secret=xxx
}}}
